"[A magistrate's] determination of probable cause should be paid great deference by reviewing courts."

"Judges are human, but they are also specially trained to decide cases on the evidence. They are conscious of the dangers of irrelevant facts and zealously guard themselves against being influenced by any facts not obtained from the evidence."

"Judges are human, but they are also specially trained to decide cases on the evidence. They are conscious of the dangers of irrelevant facts and zealously guard themselves against being influenced by any facts not obtained from the evidence."

"Judges are human, but they are also specially trained to decide cases on the evidence. They are conscious of the dangers of irrelevant facts and zealously guard themselves against being influenced by any facts not obtained from the evidence."
"Unlike the uncertainty that might exist in a jury trial, here we have the court itself making clear that it was giving no effect to the ... [prejudicial evidence]."
"Unlike the uncertainty that might exist in a jury trial, here we have the court itself making clear that it was giving no effect to the ... [prejudicial evidence]."
"[A]n appellate Court can more readily presume proper decision-making when the trier of fact is a judge."
"[A]n appellate Court can more readily presume proper decision-making when the trier of fact is a judge."
"The instant case is free from ... [a prejudicial] ... effect on a jury for the obvious reason that appellant's trial was non-jury, and as such his presumption of innocence was maintained."
"The instant case is free from ... [a prejudicial] ... effect on a jury for the obvious reason that appellant's trial was non-jury, and as such his presumption of innocence was maintained."
"The verdict of a judge, sitting without a jury, need not be nullified merely as a consequence of exposure to prejudicial evidence."
"The verdict of a judge, sitting without a jury, need not be nullified merely as a consequence of exposure to prejudicial evidence."
